intro: Achilleopsis densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered achillea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
